attributes.action: Treat NHS patients in existing local hospitals near to where they live - a reversal of current policy
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Taking West Dorset as an example, orthopaedic day surgery used to be carried out within the area, ie in Bridport - now patients must travel to Dorchester (25 miles away) or Shepton Mallet (35 miles away). Prostate surgery is currently carried out in Dorchester with "very good" clinical outcomes but despite this, your government's latest proposals would move this surgery to Bournemouth (50 miles away). Patients and their families do not need the added expense, inconvenience and stress of this extra travel.
